homeExemptions.postDeathTreatment: subject to recovery if part of probate estate and no protected heirs remain

recoveryTimeframes.statuteLimit: 8 months from date of death or probate filing

criteria: recovery would result in eviction or homelessness
heir relies on inherited property for basic needs

spousalProtections.jointPropertyTreatment: not subject to recovery while spouse is alive
additionalProtections: no recovery from estate of surviving spouse

administrative.agency: Hawaii Department of Human Services (DHS), Med-QUEST Division

programEffectiveness.estatesPursued: probate estates with real property or substantial assets

effectiveStrategies: avoid probate using revocable trusts or TOD deeds
apply for hardship waiver in low-income heir situations
establish QIT if over income threshold
use joint ownership with survivorship rights to bypass probate
